com.relteq.sirius.simulator
Interface InterfaceComponent

All Known Implementing Classes:
_Controller, _Event, _Sensor
public interface InterfaceComponent

Common interface for controllers, sensors, and events.

Method Summary
 void populate(java.lang.Object jaxbobject)
          Populate the component with configuration data.
 void reset()
          Prepare the component for simulation.
 void update()
          Update the state of the component.
 boolean validate()
          Validate the component.
 

Method Detail

populate

void populate(java.lang.Object jaxbobject)
Populate the component with configuration data.

Called once by ObjectFactory.createAndLoadScenario(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, double, double, double). It is passed a JAXB object with data loaded from the configuration file. Use this function to populate and initialize all fields in the component.

Parameters:
jaxbobject - Object

validate

boolean validate()
Validate the component.

Called once by ObjectFactory.createAndLoadScenario(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, double, double, double). It checks the validity of the configuration parameters. Events are validated at their activation time. All other components are validated when the scenario is loaded.

Returns:
true if the data is valid, false otherwise.

reset

void reset()
           throws com.relteq.sirius.simulator.SiriusException
Prepare the component for simulation.

Called by _Scenario.run(int) each time a new simulation run is started. It is used to initialize the internal state of the component.

Because events are state-less, the _Event class provides a default implementation of this method, so it need not be implemented by other event classes.

Throws:
com.relteq.sirius.simulator.SiriusException

update

void update()
            throws com.relteq.sirius.simulator.SiriusException
Update the state of the component.

Called by _Scenario.run(int) at each simulation time step. This function updates the internal state of the component.

Because events are state-less, the _Event class provides a default implementation of this method, so it need not be implemented by other event classes.

Throws:
com.relteq.sirius.simulator.SiriusException
